description: Lok Nayak Hospital has expressed condolences to the family of Late Lakhjeet Singh, who succumbed to COVID-19 this morning after one of the family members shared version claiming that hospital refused to admit the patient.  "The administration and staff of Lok Nayak Hospital expresses our heartfelt condolences to the family of Late Shri Lakhjeet Singh, who...
text:
NEW DELHI, June 5 \-- Lok Nayak Hospital has expressed condolences to the
family of Late Lakhjeet Singh, who succumbed to COVID-19 this morning after
one of the family members shared version claiming that hospital refused to
admit the patient. However, the Hospital administration said that patient was
not refused admission and was examined by doctor.

In a statement issued by the Hospital, it said that the grieving family member
of the deceased has shared a version of events on social media regarding the
unfortunate passing away of her father. "It is being implied that the death
occurred due to the hospital authorities' refusal of admission. While we fully
stand by the family in this difficult time, it is important to place the facts
on record," it said.

"The administration and staff of Lok Nayak Hospital expresses our heartfelt
condolences to the family of Late Shri Lakhjeet Singh, who succumbed to
COVID-19 this morning," the hospital said in a statement.

"The first tweet regarding the alleged refusal to admit the patient was posted
at 8:05 AM (that hospital was refusing admission and they were standing
outside the hospital) and subsequently at 9:08 AM the news of the patient's
passing away was shared. Upon investigating the incident, it was found that
the Lok Nayak Hospital's auto-generated electronic casualty record had
registered the patient in question as "Brought Dead" at 7:37 AM," it said.

The hospital staff on duty has confirmed that the patient was brought in to
the hospital between 7:10 and 7:30 AM, it said, adding that he hospital wishes
to clarify that the patient was not refused admission and was examined by
doctors upon being brought in.

The hospital staff is working non-stop for the last several months and are
making every effort possible to ensure not a single life is lost, it said.

When incorrect and false claims are made about the hospital staff and widely
publicised on the internet, it severely demoralises them and hurts their
morale, it further said, adding that Lok Nayak Hospital is committed to
serving the people and making every attempt to save lives.

"We appeal to the public to show consideration towards the hospital staff in
these extraordinary circumstances," it added. Published by HT Digital Content
Services with permission from Pioneer. For any query with respect to this
article or any other content requirement, please contact Editor at
[contentservices@htlive.com](mailto:contentservices@htlive.com)

title: FALSE CLAIMS ON SOCIAL MEDIA DEMORALISES MORALE : Lok Nayak Hospital [Pioneer, The (India)]
html:
NEW DELHI, June 5 -- Lok Nayak Hospital has expressed condolences to the family of Late Lakhjeet Singh, who succumbed to COVID-19 this morning after one of the family members shared version claiming that hospital refused to admit the patient. However, the Hospital administration said that patient was not refused admission and was examined by doctor.

In a statement issued by the Hospital, it said that the grieving family member of the deceased has shared a version of events on social media regarding the unfortunate passing away of her father. "It is being implied that the death occurred due to the hospital authorities' refusal of admission. While we fully stand by the family in this difficult time, it is important to place the facts on record," it said.

"The administration and staff of Lok Nayak Hospital expresses our heartfelt condolences to the family of Late Shri Lakhjeet Singh, who succumbed to COVID-19 this morning," the hospital said in a statement.

"The first tweet regarding the alleged refusal to admit the patient was posted at 8:05 AM (that hospital was refusing admission and they were standing outside the hospital) and subsequently at 9:08 AM the news of the patient's passing away was shared. Upon investigating the incident, it was found that the Lok Nayak Hospital's auto-generated electronic casualty record had registered the patient in question as "Brought Dead" at 7:37 AM," it said.

The hospital staff on duty has confirmed that the patient was brought in to the hospital between 7:10 and 7:30 AM, it said, adding that he hospital wishes to clarify that the patient was not refused admission and was examined by doctors upon being brought in.

The hospital staff is working non-stop for the last several months and are making every effort possible to ensure not a single life is lost, it said.

When incorrect and false claims are made about the hospital staff and widely publicised on the internet, it severely demoralises them and hurts their morale, it further said, adding that Lok Nayak Hospital is committed to serving the people and making every attempt to save lives.

"We appeal to the public to show consideration towards the hospital staff in these extraordinary circumstances," it added. Published by HT Digital Content Services with permission from Pioneer.
